job_title: Tucker Leadership Lab Facilitator in Liberty, MO
pros: Ability to work outside on your own hours and to connect with leaders in the community dedicated to positive change.
cons: The Tucker Leadership Lab is tied to a college whose senior leadership does not always support tangential initiatives.

pros: Student interaction, consistent schedule, some nice coworkers.
cons: High expectations for little pay, continually adding on work with no increase in pay, not fair to all students with consistent rules, diversity and inclusion is a joke!

review_title: The sad state of small colleges
pros:
The size of campus
Size of staff
Ability to work with students
Beauty of Campus
cons:
Low paying.
Moving away from liberal arts competencies in a misguided attempt to remain viable.
Ignored guidance from experts that would help set college apart and 
Leadership does not keep promises.

pros: I had some great colleagues who truly cared about their work.
cons:
- The administration was a mess
- The pay was horrible
- The school catered to the student way too much

review_title: Generally good with a few cons
job_title: Academic Achievement Tutor in Liberty, MO
cons:
* Low-pay compared to other local jobs
* Not much guidance from management

pros:
• Great People
• Impressive college
• Workplace Reputation
• Job Flexibility and Ability to Adapt
• Acceptance of new and entry-level employees
cons:
• Nearly no communication regarding institutional changes from leadership
• Lacking ability to deal with present-day problems and situations (aka, immediate relevance)
• Right hand rarely knows what the left is doing

pros: Working as a student worker at William Jewell is great because they  are very flexible with your schedule.
cons: If you are a full time student you don't work enough hours to make a lot of money. It just gives you some spending money while you are in school.

pros: Level of care is excellent. Team environment. Can manage your portfolio of students how you wish. Rewarding job. Good work life balance.
cons: Pay is a little low. High season can have crazier hours (if you have a fair at night, have to travel, have events, etc.) but they encourage trade-time so you aren't overworked. No real upward mobility. Budget cuts.

review_title: The people care a lot about their students
pros: Students get a good education when they attend WJC.
cons: Faculty and staff are over worked and underpaid.

pros:
Good reputation within the community 
Good benefits comparatively
cons: Majority of employees graduated from William Jewell; therefore, limited views of many subjects.

pros: Great company and people and pay
cons: None that i can think of right now.

pros: Faculty and staff care deeply about students.
cons: The current President does not care about faculty, staff or students.
